subject: Learning
title: John Dewey: Learning by Doing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: John Dewey: Learning by Doing.

hook.text: In 1896, a philosopher opened a school in Chicago where children learned by cooking, sewing, and building.

buildup.text: John Dewey believed education should mirror lifeâ€”not prepare for it through abstract drills.

discovery.text: His progressive education centered hands-on projects, collaboration, and connecting learning to experience.

twist.text: Critics said it lacked rigor. Supporters said it produced thinkers instead of memorizers.

climax.text: Dewey's influence waned after Sputnik pushed schools back toward drill-based science education.

punchline.text: Dewey asked: why teach about the world when you can learn from it?

quiz.question: What was John Dewey's core educational philosophy?
options: Students learn best through hands-on experience and projects
Memorization is the most effective learning method
Children should not attend school before age 12
